intro: Castanopsis nephelioides, commonly known as the Hainan ironwood, is a species of evergreen tree native to southern China and the island of Hainan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, dense wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typically maturing in the fall. It thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
